title: 107_s1210
content: The curr_chunk is a section header titled "SHORT TITLE." The Act is named the "Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Reauthorization Act of 2002." It reauthorizes the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996, extending block grants and federal guarantees until 2007. The Act, named the "Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Reauthorization Act of 2002," extends block grants and federal guarantees until 2007 by amending various subsections to cover the years 1997 through 2007. The Housing and Community Development Act of 1992 is amended to cover fiscal years 1997 through 2007 in certain paragraphs. SEC. 3. DEFINITIONS. Section 4 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to include a definition of "housing related community development" as any tribally-owned facility or infrastructure that aids in the construction of reservation housing and reduces construction costs. The Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to define "housing related community development" as facilities or infrastructure owned by tribes that assist in constructing reservation housing and reduce costs. The term excludes activities conducted by Indian tribes under the Indian Gaming Regulatory Act. SEC. 4 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to include comprehensive housing and community development planning activities. SEC. 5 addresses the treatment of program income and labor standards. Section 104 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to require recipients to utilize income for housing related activities in accordance with the Act. Subsection (a)(2) now includes "Restricted Access or" before the word "Reduction" in the heading. The amendment to Section 104 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 now includes requirements for recipients to use program income for housing-related activities. Subsection (a)(2) has been modified to include "Restricted Access or" before the word "Reduction" in the heading, along with other changes. SEC. 6. REGULATIONS. Section 106(b)(2)(A) of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to include regulations required under the Act, including any regulations needed for amendments made after the Act's enactment. Additionally, Section 601 is amended to include housing-related community development activities consistent with the Act's purposes. Section 202 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to include housing-related community development activities as consistent with the Act's purposes. Subsection (b) is removed, and subsections (c) and (d) are redesignated as subsections (b) and (c), respectively. Additionally, a community development demonstration project is introduced. The Secretary will conduct a study on the feasibility of establishing a demonstration project for Indian tribes to use funds for community development projects under the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Reauthorization Act of 2002. The Secretary will conduct a study on the feasibility of establishing community development demonstration projects for Indian tribes under the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Reauthorization Act of 2002. The study will be submitted to relevant Senate and House committees within one year of the Act's enactment. The Secretary will conduct a study on the feasibility of establishing a demonstration project for Indian tribes to receive assistance in a manner that maximizes tribal authority and decision-making. This study will be submitted to relevant Senate and House committees. Organizations authorized to receive assistance should prioritize tribal authority and decision-making in Federal housing funding. The Secretary will conduct a study on this and submit it to relevant Senate and House committees. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development will conduct a study on black mold infestation in Native American housing within 180 days of the Act's enactment. A report with recommendations to address the infestation will be submitted to Congress.
